content.question: Which of the following is the most practical solution to maximizing energy production at wind farms while minimizing the risk to wildlife?

choices.label: Turn on turbines only at night when most birds and bats are not flying.
Turn off turbines during periods of maximum migration.

Turn on turbines only when winds are below <math alttext="5 miles per hour" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mrow><mtext>mph</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Limit the height of turbines to <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meters and the width of the blades to <math alttext="5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meters.

content.answer: Turn off turbines during periods of maximum migration.
